## Baselines {.tabset .tabset-faded}

We're interested in using a standardised baseline time period for CC, MA, JU and CO. Here is a demonstration of how the baselines change for CC, MA and JU when the standardised timeframe is either 2010 or 2015. For MA and JU, the original baselines are up to 2021, and are in red. A CC baseline up to 2021 has not been run.

Important to note is that I have not change the JU_consequence model, which gives the MAp threshold above which the number of Juveniles required for fast recovery is no longer supported. This model uses all data up to 2021 still, but I am not familiar with it so have not adjusted it yet. 

For RPI, the input data is the modelled cover from the temporal models, which change from site level to reef level. The recognition of recovery trajectories changed slightly as it is triggered by a threshold in % HC loss, which may have change from the site level model to the reef level model. This checks how the baseline trajectories for each Bioregion x Depth change.

## Reef level trends in scores 

In the first plot, Dark Blue (reference score) and Dark purple (contextual score) are the data from the DMS

Light blue and light purple of from the re-run in September 2025. So comparing the blues with each other and purples with each other in the 'original plot' demonstrate the effects of the minimum changes that were made to get the code running and get sensible results for juveniles. Changes made followed Angus' changes in his case study, except when they were case study-specific of course, or I couldn't get them to work.

The plot below is then the new run adjusted so that the baseline period is set to data up to 2015.

For the juveniles, the DMS data was wrong, so it isn't used for comparison here. The capping of the distance for the reference metric was also changed from -3,3 to -2,2 in the baselines to 2015 version. You can see that the reference scores cover a greater range of the scale, with more scores getting closer to 1.

For recovery performance, the dark blue and dark purple are from Kerryn's last run on her desktop, because the DMS didn't have the carry-over scores for disturbance years, and therefore a lot of NAs.

## NRM level trends in scores 

In the first plot, Dark Blue (reference score) and Dark purple (contextual score) are the data from the DMS

Light blue and light purple of from the re-run in September 2025. So comparing the blues with each other and purples with each other in the 'original plot' demonstrate the effects of the minimum changes that were made to get the code running and get sensible results for juveniles.

The plot below is then the new run adjusted so that the baseline period is set to data up to 2015.

For the juveniles, the DMS data was wrong, so it isn't used for comparison here. The capping of the distance for the reference metric was also changed from -3,3 to -2,2. The reference scores should be a bit closer to 1 in the new plot.

For recovery performance, the dark blue and dark purple are from Kerryn's last run on her desktop, because the DMS didn't have the carry-over scores for disturbance years, and therefore a lot of NAs.
